titles.title: Mouretsu Pirates
Mouretsu Space Pirates
Moretsu Pirates
Mini-skirt Space Pirates
맹렬 우주해적
Moretsu Pirates
Mouretsu Uchuu Kaizoku
Moretsu Uchuu Kaizoku
モーパイ
mopai
moupai
モーレツ宇宙海賊[パイレーツ] BODACIOUS SPACE PIRATES
Bodacious Space Pirates
Bodacious Space Pirates
暴力宇宙海贼

relatedanime.anime: Mouretsu Pirates: Abyss of Hyperspace - Akuu no Shin`en

recommendations.recommendation:
Interesting premise, and for the most part lively and well-defined characters. However, an unrelenting onslaught to suspension of disbelief on many fronts. Too many to list, but I call attention to the ridiculous motivations and tendencies of the various `pirates`/privateers.
A good watch if you don`t tend to read into things.
very enjoyable to watch, but at the end it feels like a 26 episodes long intro... The story is just about to start and I want more!

likeable characters that seem to be deftly handled versions of recognizable anime-types in a light-hearted, well-crafted slice of entertainment. A portrayal that suggests a world where suffering and pain never go down beyond a certain point. A thouroughly enjoyable change from those unbearably adolescent the-universe-is-inherently-evil productions.

The OP makes my soul burn.
Off to a pretty slow start, but because of the quality of the characters, infinite room for growth.
There are much worse shows out there.

If you go into this expecting a harsh story with lots of details and death, you`ll hate it. However, if you expect a coming of age story with light comedy that never takes itself too seriously, you`ll love it. All around quality is very good, and I look forward to a second season!
Really enjoyable show with good music, nice characters and good animation.
Good entertaining anime. Enjoyable and fun.

It`s a very light anime, good character design, a little slow at the start, but you will enjoy the serie
Un aniome bastante ligero, muy buen diseño de personaje, un poco lenta al principio, pero una buen serie para disfrutar

I liked it. But don`t ask me why because i honestly can`t say. By all means it should have been boring but watching them talk about the technical aspects and the whole strategy behind space battle kinda roped me in. If you are looking for action this is not for you. It`s laid back, relaxed, like watching someone learn how to play chess. (bad analogy?) Characters were nice, nothing more, nothing less. Art Style was right up my alley, I mean great captains coat over high school girl uniform is so strange it`s cool. All in all I had fun watching it with a friend.
Cute characters and pretty accurate physics.

your average high school girl intro. But instead of the average must fulfill destiny, this is about the girl learning to be a pirate HER way. No magic, no secrets, exploring to be a pirate and excellent character support. True some characters are to obvious added but otherwise it would not be a anime.
If you like space, technological combat and freedom of a pirate. this is something for you.

anime.description: * Based on a light novel series titled Miniskirt Uchuu Pirates by http://anidb.net/cr8563 [Sasamoto Yuuichi], illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr16113 [Matsumoto Noriyuki]. Most families have a skeleton or two in the closet, but http://anidb.net/ch35552 [Marika] is understandably shocked to learn that what her family has been hiding is a skull and crossbones! And while the revelation that her late father was a space pirate would have been earthshaking enough for most teenage girls, discovering that he was the captain of the notorious pirate ship http://anidb.net/ch45948 [Bentenmaru] will change Marika`s life forever, since pirating is a family business, and she just inherited the position of captain. Understandably her father`s former crew is quite intent on making sure Marika accepts the job. So what is she to do? Well, if you are a high school student whose prior total naval experience has been working at the space yacht club, intergalactic buccaneering will come as a challenge... Source: Sentai Filmworks (edited)

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: transfer student
tag.description: A transfer student is a student who changes from one institution or course to another at the same level. Their arrival, when not at the beginning of the school year, tends to cause a stir.

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: cosplaying
tag.description: This character likes to cosplay.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: school excursion
tag.description: True for almost all anime with school setting, there will be a school excursion or field trip. Tokyo and Kyoto seem to be particularly popular as sightseeing destinations. So are hiking excursions into the local mountains. This also is a good excuse to present the prefecture`s / city`s food specialities. Potential for ecchi moments: Obviously the "boys" will get all sorts of ideas with the "girls" sleeping so close by.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: dark-skinned girl
tag.description: The anime features a girl with dark skin. A fetish of sorts, since the other protagonists are usually as white-skinned as porcelain dolls.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: strategy
tag.description: Instead of blindly running into a battle or trap, at least one of the protagonists devises a clever strategy to significantly improve the odds of victory.

tag.name: space pirates
tag.description: Depending how you view the future, lawlessness will always be present in society. There`s always going to be a shadier, nastier way of doing business, and that will almost certainly follow humanity to the stars. Thus, sci-fi authors will include Expies of modern and historic (un)organized crime—be they space mafia, gangs, or—in our case—pirates. It`s not as anachronistic as it might seem. After all, pirates themselves have made a Real Life comeback in Somalia, and it`s a lucrative enough "business" that it`s taken a multinational military response to fight back. Surely an established society in outer space with significant trade and commerce would suffer similar problems! ... Well, maybe. The major problem with space pirates preying on space commerce is that space is vast. The challenge of catching commercial shipping in open space is orders of magnitudes more difficult than catching them on the open seas. Sometimes, this is cleverly worked around and justified. Most of the time, however, it isn`t. There are two kinds of Space Pirates in science fiction. The normal version are violent criminals with a spaceship, who attack other spaceships, just like present-day pirates. Once you have shipping between different solar systems/planets, pirates preying on said shipping are bound to show. Simple as that. Done this way, piracy actually makes sense, provided there`s an enabling factor. That could be anything from the technology of the setting creating trade lanes (via a Portal Network, predictable Faster Than Light Travel routes thanks to Negative Space Wedgies, or timed space flights between planets to reduce time spent between planets, as in Real Life), to using a variant of the method employed by modern pirates (say, smaller ships striking at commercial shipping in the orbit of a planet). The other version does a Recycled In SPACE on every eighteenth century pirate cliche ever. Reasons for including this version will typically be along the lines of "Because Space Is An Ocean, it has to have Pirates" rather than making any meaningful attempt at justifying their existence. They have Cornish accents, beards, say "Arr!" a lot, have parrots (probably robot) and false limbs (probably cybernetic) and wear tricorn hats and eyepatches (or have cybernetic eyes). They may even have ships shaped like boats. One of the best known space pirates is http://anidb.net/ch2087 [Captain Harlock] from the same named popular http://anidb.net/a725 [TV anime series]. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: sociocultural evolution
tag.description: Describes how cultures and societies develop over time, based on both cultural evolution and social evolution. A post-apocalyptic or a Utopian setting would show very interesting changes in human behaviour, mental state, or simply daily life.

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: drastic change of life
tag.description: One or more characters in this series go through an event that makes them change their way of life drastically and permanently. This change might be voluntary, or against the character`s will. Some examples might be an accident, the gaining of superpowers, or simply graduating.

tag.name: detailed landscapes
tag.description: An amazing view of nature, of artificially sculpted landscapes (i.e. gardens), or of a cityscape.

tag.name: faster-than-light travel
tag.description: Faster-than-light travel is taken for grated in this anime. This is achieved by travelling via hyperspace, nullspace, or wormholes.

tag.name: lost technology
tag.description: Any advanced technology or science-related knowledge that was lost for some reason fits the description. This could be technology from a time before a post-apocalyptic cataclysm, knowledge gained a long time ago but forgotten, or the relics of an old alien civilization only recently discovered.

tag.name: battle of wits
tag.description: There is some intellectual battle between the characters. They each might attempt to discern what the other knows and/or could be planning. Then, rather than simply relying on the use of raw power, try to deduce an effective strategy to foil their opponent(s). The battle of wits can be in the center of the intrigue or just a side story. Examples: Death Note, Code Geass

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Chiaki Kurihara
character.description: A mysterious young woman who transferred to Hakuhou Girls` Academy`s Senior High School division from a branch school on the planet of Uminomorihoshi (Forest Star of the Sea). For some reason she`s used to handling computers and weapons and is extremely knowledgeable about the whole pirate situation. Source: Official Site

character.name: Katou Marika
character.description: A first year student who attends the Senior High School division of Hakuhou Girls` Academy on the planet of Uminoakehoshi (Morning Star of the Sea). A member of the yacht club. She was a normal high school girl with perfect behavior and excellent grades, until suddenly, one day, she is asked to assume the position of captain of a space pirate ship. She has a very bright personality and a lot of friends. Source: Official Site

character.name: Coorie
character.description: In charge of electronic warfare, and transmissions and correspondence on the Bentenmaru. She likes sweets and always has something in her mouth. Source: Official Site

character.name: Gruier Serenity
character.description: The 7th legitimate imperial princess of the royal family of the Serenity Stellar Kingdoms Alliance. Her ability to take action is extraordinary, and her mind is also very level-headed. However, due to her royal upbringing, she`s rather ignorant of common every-day things. Source: Official Site

character.name: Kane McDougal
character.description: He infiltrates Hakuhou Girls` Academy`s High School division under the guise of a teacher. He is also the advisor for the yacht club, but his true identity is the helmsman of the Bentenmaru. Along with http://anidb.net/ch37525 [Misa], he supports and instructs http://anidb.net/ch35552 [Marika] as she tries to observe and learn how to become the ship`s captain. Source: Official Site

character.name: Misa Grandwood
character.description: She infiltrates Hakuhou Girls` Academy`s High School division under the guise of a school nurse. However, she is actually a veteran who has served as the doctor for the Bentenmaru since the time http://anidb.net/ch37528 [Ririka] was still actively working on board. She teaches http://anidb.net/ch35552 [Marika] how to prepare for her role as the ship`s captain. Source: Official Site

character.name: Luca
character.description: The navigator of the Bentenmaru. She has a habit of holding her hand out over her circular radar while muttering "I can see it......." Source: Official Site

character.name: Sandaime
character.description: The engineer as well as the person in charge of damage control on the Bentenmaru. There is no doubt that he is skilled and he`s a trustworthy "mechanic man." Source: Official Site

character.name: Katou Ririka
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch35552 [Marika]`s mother. She was a legendary female pirate, known as "Blaster Ririka," but after she separated from her husband Gonzaemon, she started working at Shin Okuhama Airport as an air-traffic controller and brought up Marika on her own. Naturally, she hid the fact that she was a pirate from Marika, but because Gonzaemon`s death caused Bentenmaru`s crew to contact them directly, she had to disclose the truth. Source: Official Site

character.name: Hyakume
character.description: In charge of the radar laser systems on the Bentenmaru. Also wholly in charge of information gathering and its analysis. Source: Official Site

character.name: Endou Mami
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch35552 [Marika]`s classmate. She`s not in the yacht club, but after school, they work together part-time at Cafe Lamp House. For Marika, Mami is a companion that makes her feel at ease when they`re together. Source: Official Site

character.name: Grunhilde Serenity
character.description: The 8th legitimate imperial princess of the royal family of the Serenity Stellar Kingdoms Alliance, and the younger sister of http://anidb.net/ch37522 [Gruier]. Source: Official Site

character.name: Jenny Dolittle
character.description: President of the yacht club. A third year student at Hakuhou Girls` Academy`s Senior High School division. The daughter of the president of a major interstellar transportation company. Source: Official Site

character.name: Yotof Sif Sideux
character.description: Grand Chamberlain of the Privy Council of the Serenity Star System.

character.name: Lynn Lambretta
character.description: Vice President of the yacht club. A second year student at Hakuhou Girls` Academy`s Senior High School division. Has previously been convicted and put on probation for computer hacking during her Junior High School days. Source: Official Site

character.name: Stone
character.description: Stone was the captain of the pirate ship Big Catch before its destruction at the hands of the Grand Cross. Source: Mouretsu Pirate Wikia

episode.title: 海賊, 罷り通る
Pirates Coming Through
Pirates en plein jour
Piratas Chegando!
Kaizoku, Makaritooru
episode.summary: Marika Katou is a normal highschool girl, living somewhere in space. At school, she enjoys being in the yacht club, and after school she works as a waitress at the Cafe "Lamp". One day, she is suddenly asked to become captain of the space pirate ship Bentenmaru. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 私の力, 海賊の力
My Power, the Power of the Pirates
Ma force, la force des pirates...
A Minha Força, A Força Dos Piratas!
Watashi no Chikara, Kaizoku no Chikara
episode.summary: Marika struggles with her decision to become captain of the Bentenmaru. Her mom takes her out to the countryside and gives her a gun that can shoot through tanks, and an even greater power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦は深夜
The Final Battle Is at Midnight
Duel couleur nuit
Kessen wa Shinya
episode.summary: The Odette II continues its voyage through the Tau Ceti system. As they near the other side of the sun, their communications are blocked by an unknown source. High-frequency radar shows the jamming`s coming from a ghost ship, a Colony Federation vessel that sank over 120 years ago. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オデット二世, 出航!
The Odette II Leaves Port!
Odette II, lancement !
Odette Nisei, Shukkou!
episode.summary: It`s time for the practice cruise, as the Odette-II takes off for a journey around the solar system. But whoever tried to hack into them earlier is still out there, and ancient ship has mechanical problems of its own... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 姫と海賊
The Princess and the Pirate
La princesse et la pirate
Hime to Kaizoku
episode.summary: The stowaway has come aboard the Bentenmaru in search of Captain Kato to ask a favor. It’s a simple favor, which puts Marika and the crew in a new battle that can’t be solved with piracy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 平穏ままならず
The Peace Does Not Last
La paix ne dure jamais
Heion Mamanarazu
episode.summary: Marika is a pirate now. But this means her grades start slipping, and since she can`t go too far from home, the Bentenmaru`s finances are in bad shape. To make up the slack, they`re forced to take a rush job, but there`s more going on than meets the eye... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 茉莉香, 初仕事する
Marika`s First Day at Work
La première mission
Marika, Hatsu Shigoto Suru
episode.summary: Marika has decided to become a pirate captain. She fills out all the forms, but there`s a clause she didn`t know about: She has only 50 days to do an actual piracy mission, or her Letter is invalid. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 茉莉香, 決意する
Marika Makes a Decision
La résolution de Marika
Marika, Ketsui Suru
episode.summary: The electronic battle between the Odette II and the mysterious ship has begun. Marika’s plan of tricking the opposing ship is working well, but once the Odette II goes on the offensive. The mysterious ship shows it has more firepower than they bargained for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 永遠[とわ]よりの帰還
A Return from Eternity
Retour des jours perdus
Towa yori no Kikan
episode.summary: The crew of the Bentenmaru and the soldiers of the Serenity Fleet are racing toward the treasure on the ghost ship. But the closer they get to their goal; it becomes obvious the treasure is bigger than imagined. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 閃光の彷徨者[ワンダラー]
Wanderer of Light
Le vagabond de lumière
Senkou no Wanderer
episode.summary: The Bentenmaru is up against the mysterious Serenity Fleet, 1 ship vs. 7. With battle imminent, another space riff happens bringing the prize everyone seeks. But who will claim it first? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嵐の砲撃戦
Battle in the Storm
Des canons dans la tempête
Arashi no Hougekisen
episode.summary: As Chiaki fills in for Marika, the crew of the Bentenmaru is continuing their search for Golden Ghost Ship in a dangerous area. But in the rough weather, they meet Serenity warships; will the Princess be able to prevent a battle? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 華麗なる船出
A Beautiful Launch
Départ en grande pompe
Kareinaru Funade
episode.summary: The Bentenmaru watches as the ship carrying the information they need is attacked by its own fleet. The princess makes the Fleet stand down, and they get the information they need. The "Golden Ghost Ship" they seek is plotting a dangerous course through nebulas and black holes, and they`ve got no choice but to go straight after it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! ネビュラカップ
Final Battle at the Nebula Cup
Finale ! Nebula Cup
Kessen! Nebula Cup
episode.summary: As the girls register for the Nebula Cup, the other contestants and officials seem on edge. What happened five years ago and who is that person hunting for Marika? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 茉莉香[せんちょう], 波に乗る
The Captain Rides the Waves
Le capitaine surfe sur la vague
Senchou, Nami ni Noru
episode.summary: The yacht club plans to enter the 19th Nebula Club, a competition the school was ban from for 5 years. Kayne, now the P.E. teacher, sets up a race to determine which girl is qualified to race one of the dinghies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四人の絆
The Bonds Among the Four
Ce qui les rapproche
Yonin no Kizuna
episode.summary: The real crew of the Bentenmaru is going to be released soon. Marika has taken it upon herself to clean the ship, a job bigger than she expected. When the crew attempts to get access to the bridge, they find the master lock on and Marika has lost the key! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 打ち上げはジュース
We`ll Have Juice at the After Party
Victoire au jus de fruits
Uchiage wa Juice
episode.summary: Jenny is the new client of the Bentenmaru, the original plan of taking her to Space University is on hold as it will not stop the threat of her Uncle. With some inside information, the new plan is to head to Jenny’s fiancé ship to cut a deal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 意外なる依頼人
A Surprising Client
Surprenant commanditaire
Igai Naru Irainin
episode.summary: For Marika, being a pirate is about taking risks, and kidnapping is something licensed pirates do not engage in. Before Marika can put her plan into action, an unidentified ship heading toward the Bentenmaru changes everything. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初仕事! 白凰海賊団
The Hakuoh Pirates` First Job
Au boulot ! La bande de Hakuo
Hatsu Shigoto! Hakuou Kaizoku Dan
episode.summary: The yacht club members are settling into their roles aboard the pirate ship. But once Marika announces ìItís time for some piracy!î the girls are placed upon a new stage with surprising results. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 密航出航大跳躍
Smuggling, Leaving Port, and a Leap
Faux départ
Mikkou Shukkou Dai Chouyaku
episode.summary: Marika has found her crew, but training them to work the Bentenmaru might prove impossible. Hidden cameras allow Marika’s quarantine crew watch the events unfold. Can they help this rookie crew before they damage the Bentenmaru? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 茉莉香, 募集する
Marika Goes Recruiting
Marika recrute
Marika, Boshuu Suru
episode.summary: The crew of the Bentenmaru is under quarantine after transferring infected cat-monkeys. It’s only for 2 weeks, but after treatment and follow up, it could be over a month. Marika will lose her license if she doesn`t do piracy for a month. Where is she going to find a crew in time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 茉莉香, 招待する
Marika Sends an Invitation
Marika vous invite
Marika, Shoutai Suru
episode.summary: Marika thought her time with the royalty of Serenity was over, until Gurier and her sister showed up at Hakuoh Girls’ Academy. It’s back to grind of balancing her life as a Pirate, Student, Daughter, and now mentor to the Serenity Sisters. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開催! 海賊会議
The Pirate`s Council Begins
L`assemblée pirate
Kaisai! Kaizoku Kaigi
episode.summary: Mysterious continue to unfold during the pirate council; where is the real Luca, what is Kayne’s secret, and is Ironbeard a friend or foe? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 傷だらけの弁天
The Wounded Benten
Benten à genoux
Kizu Darake no Benten
episode.summary: A fight against the warship Grand Cross, a traitor within the ranks of the Bentenmaru, and Marika’s secret plans for the pirate council; It has never been a more exciting time to be a pirate, or more dangerous. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目指せ! 海賊の巣
Head for the Pirate`s Nest
Dans l`antre des pirates
Mezase! Kaizoku no Su
episode.summary: Grand Cross, the pirate hunting ship that’s been causing havoc and the Parabellum, a ship registered to the Galactic Empire. What is the connection between these two ships and can anyone stop them? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海賊狩り
Pirate Hunting
La chasse aux pirates
Kaizoku Kari
episode.summary: Pirate crews and ships are being destroyed by an unknown assailant. The Bentenmaru has 20 days until their pirate license expires making this a dangerous time to be pirate. But Captain Marika has a plan up her sleeve. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: そして, 海賊は行く
There Go the Pirates
Et les pirates repartirent
Soshite, Kaizoku wa Iku
episode.summary: Its Marika versus Quartz, Marika has rallied all the pirates to confront Quartz in a winner take all battle. But no one expect for three Grand Cross battleships to appear. Source: crunchyroll
